page.title: 19Weston School: Some Opinions
page.content:
The community of Weston is saddened by the loss of its school which can only increase the age imbalance in its pop- ulation. The high cost of housing and Weston's designation as a 'No Growth' village have already discouraged young couples from settling in the village and the closure of the school will not improve the situation.
Local parents feel that their children (bussed to 3 different schools) have lost the benefit of living in a strong integrated community. Many people will miss events such as the Christmas Bazaar and Carol Singing which brought them together at the school. Older people miss the ringing of the school bell and the sound of the children's games at playtime or as they jumped the stile to shortcut home along the field path.
